IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Mental health and Chemical dependency Services
IRS990.MissionDescription: The mission of the Western Montana Mental Health Center is to assist individuals and communities with the challenges of mental health, substance use and co-occurring disorders in order to achieve their highest quality of life in a relationship of mutual respect, dignity and empowerment.
IRS990.Description: Adult day treatment to 621 clients; 118,788 hoursCrisis services to 644 clients; 5,203 daysAdult case management to 3,498 clients; 90,892 hoursSupported employment to 169 clients; 1,406 hoursPACT to 233 clients; 64,996 daysTransitional Home Care to 142 clients; 16,376 daysCommunity living support to 1,449 clients; 45,585 hoursEmergency Evaluations to 3,042 clients; 19,720 hours

Activity2.Description: Comprehensive School & community treatment to 409 clients; 36,061 hoursChildren's case management to 1031 clients; 36,340Therapeutic foster care/ group care to 27 clients; 4,355 daysFamily-based services to 107 clients; 9,814 days

Activity3.Description: Outpatient services to 10,400 clients; 58,538 hoursOutpatient group to 747 clients; 7,754 hours

ActivityOther.Description: Chemical dependency treatment and after-school substance abuse prevention programs to 2887 clients and 7891 participants, respectively. Client housing.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The income from the endowment is available for use by Turning point.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Center and its affiliate apply generally accepted accounting principles for recognition of uncertainty in income taxes and prescribing a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. The Center and its affiliate have analyzed tax positions taken for filing with the Internal Revenue Service and all state jurisdictions where it operates. The Center and its affiliate believe that income tax filing positions will be sustained upon examination and does not anticipate any adjustments that would result in a material adverse effect on its financial condition, results of operations or cash flows. Accordingly, the Center and its affiliatee have not recorded any reserves or related accruals for interest or penalties for uncertain income tax positions as of June 30, 2010.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 is provided to the CFO, who reviews it prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Directors surveyed salaries at similar non-profits in the state of Montana when determining the Executive Director's salary.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WMMHC makes its governing documents, financial statements and forms 1032,990 and 990-T available on their internal portal and are available to all offices. Additionally, they are available upon request.
This process has not changed from the prior year.
